Notes.Text:
This update for emacs fixes the following issues:

  - CVE-2024-53920: Fixed arbitrary code execution via Lisp macro expansion (bsc#1233894)
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: In elisp-mode.el in GNU Emacs before 30.1, a user who chooses to invoke elisp-completion-at-point (for code completion) on untrusted Emacs Lisp source code can trigger unsafe Lisp macro expansion that allows attackers to execute arbitrary code. (This unsafe expansion also occurs if a user chooses to enable on-the-fly diagnosis that byte compiles untrusted Emacs Lisp source code.)
